column4: I need help for partitionning :( nobody can help me ? it takes only 2~5 minutes :(
What kind of help?
I want to install Ubuntu on my notebook and I suck at partitionning
I just need a "plan" to do that with a 120gb HDD
ok, do you have any other OS? Windows?
no... I had :D but it sucks for a notebook
Why yes it does :D  ... so you want one partition for / ... say 20GB, plus a swap partition (how much RAM do you have?) and a /home partition, which will fill the rest of the drive
so, you will want to use manual when you get the the point in the installer where you partition the drive
I have 1gb ram... Also, I'd like to know if I should do a /tmp partition
nah, I don't think that's really useful
k, so do 3GB for swap
Have you decided whether you want to use ext3 or ext4?
okay ;) So 20gb for /, 3gb for swap and the rest for /home ? is that it ?
yep, other than choosing the filesystem for / and /home
I don't even know the differences :D
I mean with ext3/ext4
ext3 is the default - very stable, well supported etc... ext4 is the new version that should have some good performance benefits, but as it is new it's less well supported (but it is stable)
!ext4
:O
you think I should be using ext4 ? or not ?

up to you... I've been saying for a while that ext4 isn't ready, but I've switched my / partition to ext4 now and I'll be switching /home soon too... a bunch of fixes have been implemented for little things, so I'd say it's ready to use now, yes
okay ;) thank you very much :)
For example, my boot time was cut by about 30% because /boot is ext4 for me now
ho okay... I see why ext4 is useful ^^ thanks !
